Hydras:

Hydras was uneasy, MAxima hadn't reported and that was unusual. The 
male opened her commlink in MAxima freceuncy and said "Hydras to 
Maxima, do you copy?.... Maxima where're you, my sweet Tigress?"

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 6/5/03 9:16:58 PM Central Daylight Time, 
> Proudwing500k@h... writes:
> 
> 
> > After some cycles of flight, he figured he was near the spark's
> > position. He transformed to dragon mode and a cloud of frost 
shot out
> > from his armor plates. He looked around, but saw no one.
> > 
> > AzureBlade: Hello? Is there anyone here?
> > 
> > 
> 
> Hearing a voice, it sounded like something from a human fantasy 
fairy or some 
> strange special effect to her. Her audion receptors were clouded 
by the 
> strange energetic waters. Her optics tried to locate the voice. 
> 
> But, with a step from the waterfall, it seemed as though she were 
like some 
> spirit that just appeared from the water, her form shimmering from 
the energy 
> water & the sun. Her crimson optics glowed as she caught the sight 
of the blue 
> dragon before her on the edge of the lagoon. She stood there, 
just... watching 
> him. Cocking her head to the side. She seemed... innocent at the 
moment. 
> But... lost. 
> 
> Standing on the stones a moment, her feathery mane whipped around 
her by the 
> turbulence in the air caused by the waterfall & wind. her wings 
were heavily 
> damaged, but her form seemed to be healing. A gift from the waters 
of this 
> strange lagoon. 
> 
> Her crimson optics gazed at the blue dragon as she stood there as 
though she 
> were standing on the water itself. Her form still shimmering.
